Why I've been absent, and why the DC rocks
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Why I've been absent, and why the DC rocks
By B Campbell on Sunday, March 17, 2002 - 10:11 am:

Sorry I haven't been around, if anyone has noticed. The main reason is because I've been buying cheap Dreamcast games in record numbers. Well, it's a record for me at least. I've picked up the following games in the last week:

Rayman 2
Virtua Tennis
Seventh Cross: Evolution
Super Runabout - San Fransisco
Test Drive V-Rally
Speed Devils Online Racing
Ecco the Dolphin

All of this was under $100, including tax & shipping. Some of these games are under $10 (super runabout and test drive were the only ones over $20 and they were $25). So I'm going to be a bit busy with other games, which is a shame because I was having some fun with MR2.

Now, I dare anyone to find as much gameplay for the price on the PS2, Xbox, or Gamecube!

By Animatrix4 on Tuesday, March 19, 2002 - 12:06 am:

If you want to talk replay-ability BC, then i have to agree with hengersrock, the Genesis was one of the best systems of its day, only failing because the SNES got Street Fighter 2 first, however, he forgot to mention the Sega CDX which allowed those great games like Lunar: The silver Story to be played. Ecco, Sonic (any of them, all of great gameplay), and Streets of Rage (only played 1 and 2, and 2 was the better IMHO) are just some of the wonders the Sega had. At $40 for the genesis, and games anywhere between $5 and $50 (the really rare ones), the Genesis or Sega CDX has one of the best video game libraries available.

By B Campbell on Tuesday, March 19, 2002 - 06:58 pm:

Yeah, i actually have a 'Genesis 3', the last restyle. I think the only game I have is the 6-pack which has like Golden Axe and Sonic and some other games. I've been thinking of getting more games fo rit, but I already have two consoles that need outlets, and my surge strips are all full. So, I'm just going to concentrate on the DC since game prices getting so low. Just found Elemental Gimmick Gear for $5, that's going in my next batch of purchases. Unfornatunately, I do HAVE to get Soul Calibur ($25) and other games like Toky Xtreme Rcaer which are between $20-$30. Still great prices for (relatively) new games, considering the PS2 and Xbox games can cost $55.
